C++/CLI Sample
Demonstrates how to create a C++/CLI library using the VideoXpert SDK

7 using namespace System;
8 using namespace System::IO;
9 using namespace System::Collections::Generic;
10 using namespace System::Runtime::InteropServices;

12 CPPCli::VXSystem::VXSystem(String^ ip) : _loginInfo(new VxSdk::VxLoginInfo()) {
13  // Init the sdk with your key generated using VxSdkKeyGen.exe
14  String^ key = File::ReadAllText("..\\..\\..\\..\\..\\PelcoKey.txt");
15  VxSdk::VxInit(Utils::ConvertSysString(key));
16 
17  // Enter the VideoXpert IP information
18  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(_loginInfo->ipAddress, Utils::ConvertSysString(ip));
19 }
20 
21 CPPCli::Results::Value CPPCli::VXSystem::Login(String^ username, String^ password) {
22  // Enter the VideoXpert login information
23  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(_loginInfo->username, Utils::ConvertSysString(username));
24  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(_loginInfo->password, Utils::ConvertSysString(password));
25  const int kSslPort = 443;
26  _loginInfo->port = kSslPort;
27  _loginInfo->ssl = true;
28 
29  // Attempt to login to the system
30  VxSdk::IVxSystem* system = nullptr;
31  VxSdk::VxResult::Value result = VxSdk::VxSystemLogin(*_loginInfo, system);
32  if (result == VxSdk::VxResult::kOK) {
33  _system = system;
34  // Create a new callback delegate
35  _callback = gcnew EventCallbackDelegate(&_FireEvent);
36  // Internally subscribe to the system events. The client still needs to subscribe to the SystemEvent
37  // delegate in order to receive the events.
38  _system->StartNotifications(VxSdk::VxEventCallback(Marshal::GetFunctionPointerForDelegate(_callback).ToPointer()));
39  }
40  return CPPCli::Results::Value(result);
41 }
42 
43 CPPCli::VXSystem::!VXSystem() {
44  // Delete system object
45  if (_system != nullptr) {
46  // Unsubscribe to the system events
47  _system->StopNotifications();
48  delete _callback;
49  _system->Delete();
50  _system = nullptr;
51  }
52 
53  // Delete loginInfo object
54  if (_loginInfo != nullptr) {
55  delete _loginInfo;
56  }
57 }
58 
59 String^ CPPCli::VXSystem::CreateExport(CPPCli::NewExport^ newExport) {
60  String^ exportId;
61  // Create a new VxNewExportClip object using the clip info contained in newExport
62  const int clipSize = newExport->Clips->Count;
63  VxSdk::VxNewExportClip* clips = new VxSdk::VxNewExportClip[clipSize];
64  for (int i = 0; i < clipSize; i++) {
65  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(clips[i].dataSourceId, Utils::ConvertSysString(newExport->Clips[i]->DataSourceId));
66  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(clips[i].startTime, Utils::ConvertDateTimeToChar(newExport->Clips[i]->StartTime));
67  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(clips[i].endTime, Utils::ConvertDateTimeToChar(newExport->Clips[i]->EndTime));
68  }
69 
70  // Create a VxNewExport object using the settings contained in newExport and the VxNewExportClip that
71  // was just created.
72  VxSdk::VxNewExport vxExport;
73  vxExport.format = (VxSdk::VxExportFormat::Value)newExport->Format;
74  vxExport.clips = clips;
75  vxExport.clipSize = clipSize;
76  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxExport.name, Utils::ConvertSysString(newExport->Name));
77  // If the password field has a password set then the export will be password protected, if the password is not
78  // set, the export will be public
79  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxExport.password, Utils::ConvertSysString(newExport->Password));
80 
81  // Attempt to create the export
82  VxSdk::IVxExport* exportItem = nullptr;
83  VxSdk::VxResult::Value result = _system->CreateExport(vxExport, exportItem);
84 
85  // Unless there was an issue initiating the export the result should be VxSdk::VxResult::kOK
86  if (result == VxSdk::VxResult::kOK) {
87  // The exportItem returned from the system is the export initiated on the server and contains a lot of
88  // helpful information about the export.
89  exportId = gcnew String(exportItem->id);
90 
91  // This export item must still be deleted from memory
92  exportItem->Delete();
93  exportItem = nullptr;
94  }
95  return exportId;
96 }
97 
98 CPPCli::Results::Value CPPCli::VXSystem::DeleteExport(CPPCli::Export^ exportItem) {
99  // Create an export object using the exportItem
100  VxSdk::IVxExport* delExport = exportItem->_export;
101 
102  // To delete an export simply make a DeleteExport call
103  VxSdk::VxResult::Value result = delExport->DeleteExport();
104  // Unless there was an issue deleting the export the result should be VxSdk::VxResult::kOK
105  return CPPCli::Results::Value(result);
106 }
107 
108 Collections::Generic::List<CPPCli::Device^>^ CPPCli::VXSystem::GetDevices() {
109  // Create a list of managed device objects
110  List<CPPCli::Device^>^ mlist = gcnew List<CPPCli::Device^>();
111  // Create a collection of unmanaged device objects
112  VxSdk::VxCollection<VxSdk::IVxDevice**> devices;
113 
114  // Make the GetDevices call, which will return with the total device count, this allows the client to allocate memory.
115  VxSdk::VxResult::Value result = _system->GetDevices(devices);
116  // Unless there are no devices on the system, this should return VxSdk::VxResult::kInsufficientSize
117  if (result == VxSdk::VxResult::kInsufficientSize) {
118  // Allocate enough space for the IVxDevice collection
119  devices.collection = new VxSdk::IVxDevice*[devices.collectionSize];
120  result = _system->GetDevices(devices);
121  // The result should now be kOK since we have allocated enough space
122  if (result == VxSdk::VxResult::kOK) {
123  for (int i = 0; i < devices.collectionSize; i++)
124  mlist->Add(gcnew CPPCli::Device(devices.collection[i]));
125  }
126  // Remove the memory we previously allocated to the collection
127  delete[] devices.collection;
128  }
129  return mlist;
130 }
131 
132 List<CPPCli::Export^>^ CPPCli::VXSystem::GetExports() {
133  // Create a list of managed export objects
134  List<CPPCli::Export^>^ mlist = gcnew List<CPPCli::Export^>();
135  // Create a collection of unmanaged export objects
136  VxSdk::VxCollection<VxSdk::IVxExport**> exports;
137 
138  // Make the GetExports call, which will return with the total export count, this allows the client to allocate memory.
139  VxSdk::VxResult::Value result = _system->GetExports(exports);
140  // Unless there are no exports on the system, this should return VxSdk::VxResult::kInsufficientSize
141  if (result == VxSdk::VxResult::kInsufficientSize) {
142  // Allocate enough space for the IVxExport collection
143  exports.collection = new VxSdk::IVxExport*[exports.collectionSize];
144  result = _system->GetExports(exports);
145  // The result should now be kOK since we have allocated enough space
146  if (result == VxSdk::VxResult::kOK) {
147  for (int i = 0; i < exports.collectionSize; i++)
148  mlist->Add(gcnew CPPCli::Export(exports.collection[i]));
149  }
150  // Remove the memory we previously allocated to the collection
151  delete[] exports.collection;
152  }
153  return mlist;
154 }
155 
156 List<CPPCli::Situation^>^ CPPCli::VXSystem::GetSituations() {
157  // Create a list of managed situation objects
158  List<CPPCli::Situation^>^ mlist = gcnew List<CPPCli::Situation^>();
159  // Create a collection of unmanaged situation objects
160  VxSdk::VxCollection<VxSdk::IVxSituation**> situations;
161 
162  // Make the GetSituations call, which will return with the total situation count, this allows the client to allocate memory.
163  VxSdk::VxResult::Value result = _system->GetSituations(situations);
164  // The result should be kInsufficientSize if the number of situations on the system are greater than 0 (always)
165  if (result == VxSdk::VxResult::kInsufficientSize) {
166  // Allocate enough space for the IVxSituation collection
167  situations.collection = new VxSdk::IVxSituation*[situations.collectionSize];
168  result = _system->GetSituations(situations);
169  // The result should now be kOK since we have allocated enough space
170  if (result == VxSdk::VxResult::kOK) {
171  for (int i = 0; i < situations.collectionSize; i++) {
172  mlist->Add(gcnew CPPCli::Situation(situations.collection[i]));
173  }
174  }
175  // Remove the memory we previously allocated to the collection
176  delete[] situations.collection;
177  }
178  return mlist;
179 }
180 
181 CPPCli::Results::Value CPPCli::VXSystem::AddSituation(CPPCli::NewSituation^ newSituation) {
182  // Create a situation object and populate its fields using newSituation
183  VxSdk::VxNewSituation vxSituation;
184  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxSituation.name, Utils::ConvertSysString(newSituation->Name));
185  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxSituation.sourceDeviceId, Utils::ConvertSysString(newSituation->SourceDeviceId));
186  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxSituation.type, Utils::ConvertSysString(newSituation->Type));
187  vxSituation.ackNeeded = newSituation->IsAckNeeded;
188  vxSituation.audibleLoopDelay = newSituation->AudibleLoopDelay;
189  vxSituation.audibleNotify = newSituation->UseAudibleNotification;
190  vxSituation.audiblePlayCount = newSituation->AudiblePlayCount;
191  vxSituation.autoAcknowledge = newSituation->AutoAcknowledge;
192  vxSituation.expandBanner = newSituation->ShouldExpandBanner;
193  vxSituation.log = newSituation->ShouldLog;
194  vxSituation.notify = newSituation->ShouldNotify;
195  vxSituation.severity = newSituation->Severity;
196  int size = newSituation->SnoozeIntervals->Count;
197  int *intervals = new int[size];
198  for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
199  intervals[i] = newSituation->SnoozeIntervals[i];
200  }
201  vxSituation.snoozeIntervals = intervals;
202 
203  // Make the call to add the situation into VideoXpert
204  VxSdk::VxResult::Value result = _system->AddSituation(vxSituation);
205  // Unless there was an issue adding the situation the result should be VxSdk::VxResult::kOK
206  if (result == VxSdk::VxResult::kOK) {
207  // Remove the memory we previously allocated
208  delete[] vxSituation.snoozeIntervals;
209  }
210  return CPPCli::Results::Value(result);
211 }
212 
213 CPPCli::Results::Value CPPCli::VXSystem::DeleteSituation(CPPCli::Situation^ situationItem) {
214  // Create a situation object using the situationItem
215  VxSdk::IVxSituation* delSituation = situationItem->_situation;
216 
217  // To delete a situation simply make a DeleteSituation call
218  VxSdk::VxResult::Value result = delSituation->DeleteSituation();
219  // Unless there was an issue deleting the situation the result should be VxSdk::VxResult::kOK
220  return CPPCli::Results::Value(result);
221 }
222 
223 CPPCli::Results::Value CPPCli::VXSystem::InjectEvent(CPPCli::NewEvent^ newEvent) {
224  // Create a new VxNewEvent object using the information contained in newEvent
225  VxSdk::VxNewEvent vxEvent;
226  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxEvent.generatorDeviceId, Utils::ConvertSysString(newEvent->GeneratorDeviceId));
227  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxEvent.situationType, Utils::ConvertSysString(newEvent->SituationType));
228  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxEvent.sourceDeviceId, Utils::ConvertSysString(newEvent->SourceDeviceId));
229  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxEvent.time, Utils::ConvertDateTimeToChar(newEvent->Time));
230  int size = newEvent->Properties->Count;
231  VxSdk::VxKvObject *kvObj = new VxSdk::VxKvObject[size];
232  vxEvent.properties = kvObj;
233  for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
234  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxEvent.properties[i].key, Utils::ConvertSysString(newEvent->Properties[i].Key));
235  VxSdk::Utilities::StrCopySafe(vxEvent.properties[i].value, Utils::ConvertSysString(newEvent->Properties[i].Value));
236  }
237 
238  // Make the call to insert the event into VideoXpert
239  VxSdk::VxResult::Value result = _system->InsertEvent(vxEvent);
240  // Unless there was an issue inserting the event the result should be VxSdk::VxResult::kOK
241  if (result == VxSdk::VxResult::kOK) {
242  // Remove the memory we previously allocated
243  delete[] vxEvent.properties;
244  }
245  return CPPCli::Results::Value(result);
246 }
247 
248 void CPPCli::VXSystem::SystemEvent::add(EventDelegate ^eventDelegate) {
249  // Add a new subscription to the EventDelegate
250  _systemEvent += eventDelegate;
251 };
252 
253 void CPPCli::VXSystem::SystemEvent::remove(EventDelegate ^eventDelegate) {
254  // Remove the EventDelegate subscription
255  _systemEvent -= eventDelegate;
256 };
257 
258 void CPPCli::VXSystem::_FireEvent(VxSdk::IVxEvent* vxEvent) {
259  // Fire the notification if there is a subscription to the system events
260  if (_systemEvent != nullptr)
261  return _systemEvent(gcnew Event(vxEvent));
262 }
